answerText: Arrhenius equation[10] This effect occurs when the difference between the zero-point energy of a bond in the reactant and that same bond in the transition state increases when one nucleus is slightly heavier. Reaction mechanisms can be determined using this effect.
heading: ACF Regionals 2014 |2014 | Dorman-Carleton-LASA B | 16 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name this equation which sets the rate constant proportional to the exponential of negative activation energy over RT.
